_header: Most glorious queen reigning in heaven
Subjects: Virgin Mary, hymns to; hymns, to Virgin Mary
_description: A hymn to the Virgin Mary — three stanzas rhyme royal

CULFf16.First Lines:
Most glorius quene Reynyng yn heeveneSterre of the se of all this
                    worldell ladyI be seche you for all youre Joyes SeveneIn this grete
                    nede sende cumforte and mersy…
CULFf16.Last Lines:
…Of all women the chef helper in dystresseTorne all my woo in
                    to Joy and gladnesse
CULFf16.Facsimiles:
Beadle,  Richard,  and  Alfred E. B. Owen.  
             The Findern Manuscript: Cambridge University Library MS. F.1.6.
         London: Scolar Press, 1977.

Brown,  Carleton Fairchild,
                        ed.  
             Religious Lyrics of the XVth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1939: 56-7.
